result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cole James Borowicz

defendant.name: Borowicz, Cole James
defendant.address: 639 High Ridge Road, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt: 1 year

3:32 PM Defendant Cole James Borowicz in court.  Attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher in court for Cole James Borowicz.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CM5 and 22CM106 heard at this time. ADA Schieffer: guilty/no contest to Ct#1 in 22CM5 and 22CM106, dismiss Ct#2 in each case. 1 year DJOC on Ct#1 in 22CM5 and 22CM106. Atty Pletcher and Defendant agree.Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 22CM5 and 22CM106.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant  guilty to Ct#1 in 22CM5 and 22CM106. Dismisses Ct#2 in  22CM5 and 22CM106. ADA Schieffer and Atty Pletcher address sentencing. ADA Schieffer reads a message from victim. Defendant addresses the court. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 1 year DJOC on Ct#1  22CM5 and 22CM106. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Defendant to remain until handed a signed copy. 3:53
AMG
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2022 at 10:33 am.

9:33 AM Defendant Cole James Borowicz appears in Court, Atty Kenneth Charles Pletcher, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM106 (IA) and 22CM5 (STC). Court adjourned at 9:36 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:33 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH A.M.G.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service.

3:31 PM Defendant Cole James Borowicz appears by phone, Atty Kenneth Charles Pletcher appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Schieffer states the Victim is requesting NAC, Atty Pletcher in agreement. DE will be in today to sign the bond. Court adjourned at 3:34 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NO CONTACT WITH A.M.G. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF VIA PHONE (VOICE OR TEXT)
NO ENTRY INTO BARS, TAVERNS OR LIQUOR STORES

04:17 PM Defendant Cole James Borowicz in court with attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion by State.  ADA Schieffer advises of discussion with victim who would like contact only via telephone, voice or text.  No objection.  Court orders bond modification as requested.  Adjourned at 4:19 PM
Bail/bond hearing on January 27, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:04 PM Defendant Cole James Borowicz appears via videoconferecing with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson via phone.  Defendant Cole James Borowicz in custody.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms Defendant received copy of Complaint.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  Atty. Nelson enters NG pleas.  State requests $1,000 signature bond w/conditions of AS, NC w/AMG, NEBTLS.  DA Hatch notes 72-hour no contact is in effect until 01/11 at 1:33 AM.  Atty. Nelson questions residence, DA Hatch advises victim has vacated.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested and advises of additional standard conditions.  Defendant does not qualify for PD.  Court questions address, phone, dob.  Non-military.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
